name: DO fluctuation
functionStatement: Nitrogen and phosphorus transformations feed primary production, regulate excess loads, and store or release nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Daily O2 changes are moderate (<2 mg/L), unless larger swings are normal (warm swamp streams).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Analyze dissolved oxygen for diurnal swings where continuous data exist. If not, use spot checks and nutrient context as a screening proxy.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: DO dips below 3 mg/L and fish stress observed.
Criteria: < 3 mg/L dangerously low.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Night minima 3-5 mg/L during warm periods.
Criteria: 3-5 mg/L frequent stress.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: DO commonly 5-6 mg/L in late summer.
Criteria: 5-6 mg/L borderline.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: DO readings consistently above 6 mg/L. No recorded night-time dips.
Criteria: > 6 mg/L consistently.

references: USGS NWIS continuous dissolved oxygen (where available)
